meanings.definition: To sweeten or make more pleasant
meanings.sent1: She was honeying the tea to make it taste better.
meanings.sent2: The chef was honeying the sauce with a touch of sugar.
meanings.sent3: The cat was honeying up to its owner for a treat.
meanings.sent4: His words were honeying her heart, making her smile.
meanings.sent5: The sun was honeying the sky with its warm glow.

meanings.definition: To flatter or try to please
meanings.sent1: He was honeying his boss to get a promotion.
meanings.sent2: She was honeying her friend with compliments.
meanings.sent3: The child was honeying the teacher to get a better grade.
meanings.sent4: The politician was honeying the crowd with promises.
meanings.sent5: The salesman was honeying the customer to make a sale.

meanings.definition: To coat or cover with honey
meanings.sent1: She was honeying the bread with a thick layer of honey.
meanings.sent2: The bees were honeying the hive to protect it.
meanings.sent3: The chef was honeying the dessert for a sweet finish.
meanings.sent4: The artist was honeying the canvas with golden hues.
meanings.sent5: The gardener was honeying the plants to attract bees.
